author: Ricky Doyle
title: Andre Drummond Fuels Celtics Trade Rumors By Using Isaiah Thomas Tweet | Boston Celtics | NESN.com
text:
by Ricky Doyle on Tue, Feb 21, 2017 at 11:34AM 35,561 Tweet 
Consider yourself warned: This story is about as 2017 as it gets. 
We wonâ€™t let that stop us from having a good time, though, and a couple of tweets from Boston Celtics point guard Isaiah Thomas and Detroit Pistons center Andre Drummond have generated some buzz with Thursdayâ€™s NBA trade deadline rapidly approaching. 
Thomas tweeted the following eye emojis Monday night, which put a whole bunch of Celtics fans on the edge of their seats wondering if Boston was on the verge of making a move. ðŸ‘€ 
â€” Isaiah Thomas (@Isaiah_Thomas) February 21, 2017 
Why? Well, as pointed out by several astute Câ€™s followers, including MassLive.comâ€™s Jay King, Thomas sent out the same tweet just before Boston signed Al Horford over the offseason. Not saying it means anything, butâ€¦ 
Another time Isaiah Thomas tweeted the eyes emoji: right before the Al Horford signing. pic.twitter.com/MNmZ2qFRbR 
â€” Jay King (@ByJayKing) February 21, 2017 
The question thus shifted: If the Celtics are about to make a trade, who could they be getting? Jimmy Butler ? Paul George ? Andrew Bogut ? 
Hmm â€¦ how about Drummond? 
Drummond not only retweeted Thomasâ€™ eyeball tweet. He also tweeted the emojis himself Tuesday morning, adding additional fuel to the Celtics trade speculation. ðŸ‘€ 
â€” Andre Drummond (@AndreDrummond) February 21, 2017 
If that wasnâ€™t enough, Drummond apparently did some work to his Twitter profile, removing any references to the Pistons and changing his profile photo. Ok so Andre Drummond RT'd IT's ðŸ‘€ and tweeted ðŸ‘€ himself. Removed Pistons from his bio. And changed his profile pic to this. pic.twitter.com/0UPaFiHR8n 
â€” AJBZ4 (@AjaxBeatz4) February 21, 2017 
Maybe Drummond wanted to mess with peopleâ€™s heads. Maybe he just wants to be like I.T. Hell, maybe heâ€™s a big fan of eyeballs and sight is his favorite of the senses. 
It doesnâ€™t really matter. Because even though not a single word was said or tweeted by Thomas or Drummond, the internet started going crazy, which really speaks to the unpredictability surrounding this yearâ€™s trade deadline, especially as it relates to the Celtics.
